FuncDef:
The transceiver non-certified-alarm disable command disables alarm reporting for unauthenticated optical modules.
The undo transceiver non-certified-alarm disable command enables alarm reporting for unauthenticated optical modules.
By default, an alarm for unauthenticated optical modules is reported.
Examples: Warning: After this command is run, no alarm is generated when a third-party optical module is installed. Huawei will not be liable
for any problems or defects in the use of third-party optical modules! Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a third-party optical module authenticated by other vendors is inserted into a port, run the transceiver non-certified-alarm disable or undo transceiver non-certified-alarm disable command to disable or enable alarm (hwOpticalModuleIsNotAuthorized) reporting for the unauthenticated optical module.
